OOC: Never mind.  We wanted to skip the mundane and get right to the 
good stuff.  BTW, Kyle, I don't really mind.  I'm a mod myself in an 
RPG where it's considered perfectly acceptable to RP someone else's 
character for an entire conversation.  (Mostly to speed things up and 
point the story in the right direction so that it stays interesting.)

As they unload the equipment (mostly an assorted selection of things 
Gatara figures they may run low on; the Rogues already have what they 
need, more or less), Phoenix's wandering eyes find Flicker.  Now 
she's REALLY confused, because she feels like she should remember 
him, even though she doesn't.  (For those not well-versed in 
psychology, this is a case of semantic memory - emotional attachments 
- versus the regular, event-based recollections in memory engrams, 
which Phoenix has lost.)

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> OOC: Why would we get mad?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > OOC: Then let's just say it takes 2 loads so as not to
> > get the council mad.
> > 
> > BIC:  Flicker gets back, loads up under Gatara's
> > supervision (don't complain, you wanted to speed
> > things up) and heads back.
